metadata.title: Tutorials
metadata.description: Start learning with step-by-step, hands-on, command-line tutorials, videos, and hosted terminal sessions. Actionable examples help you learn to provision, secure, connect, or run any application on any infrastructure.

certification.title: Get certified: Infrastructure automation
certification.description: Validate your infrastructure automation skills by studying for and passing the Terraform Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - AWS
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy AWS infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Authenticate to AWS and create an EC2 instance under the AWS free tier. Write and validate Terraform configuration, initialize a configuration directory, and plan and apply a configuration to create infrastructure.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Modify EC2-instance configuration to use a different Ubuntu version. Plan and apply the changes to re-provision a new instance that reflects the new configuration. Learn how Terraform handles infrastructure change management.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy the AWS EC2 instance you created in the previous tutorials. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your AWS EC2 instance name as a variable. Reference the variable in Terraform configuration. Define variables using command line flags and default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with outputs
tutorials.description: Declare output values to display an EC2 instance's ID and public IP address. Display all outputs and query specific outputs. Define what data stored in Terraform state is relevant to the operator or end user.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Store remote state
tutorials.description: Configure Terraform to store state in Terraform Cloud. Add a remote state block directly to configuration or set an environment variable to load remote state configuration when Terraform initializes.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - Azure
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy Azure infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Initialize, plan and apply configuration in a directory to create an Azure resource group. Inspect the Terraform state to discover the group ID once Terraform creates it.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Add tags to an existing Azure resource group to learn how Terraform manages infrastructure changes. Edit Terraform configuration, then plan and apply the change.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy Azure infrastructure managed by Terraform. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your Azure resource group name as a variable. Reference the variable in Terraform configuration. Define a variable using command line flags or default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with output values
tutorials.description: Output the ID of an Azure resource group using output variables. Read about using outputs to query specific data from Terraform state.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Store remote state
tutorials.description: Configure Terraform to store state in Terraform Cloud. Add a remote state block directly to configuration or set an environment variable to load remote state configuration when Terraform initializes.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - Google Cloud
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Authenticate to Google Cloud and create a VPC network. Write and validate Terraform configuration, initialize a configuration directory, and plan and apply a configuration to create infrastructure.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Add a Google Compute Engine VM instance to a VPC by referencing the VPC in its configuration using arguments. Modify the instance by adding tags, and implement a destructive change.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy Google Cloud infrastructure managed by Terraform. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your GCP credential location, infrastructure region and zone as variables. Reference these variables in Terraform configuration. Define them using command line flags, environment variables, .tfvars files or default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with output values
tutorials.description: Output the public IP of your Google Cloud instance using output variables. Read about using outputs to query specific data from Terraform state.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

certification.title: Get certified: Security automation
certification.description: Validate your cloud security skills by studying for and passing the Vault Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.name: CLI quick start
featuredCollections.description: Vault secures, stores, and tightly controls access to tokens, passwords, certificates, API keys, and other secrets in modern computing. Get started here.

tutorials.name: What is Vault
tutorials.description: What is HashiCorp Vault and where does it fit in your organization?

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Install Vault
tutorials.description: The first step to using Vault is to get it installed.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Starting the server
tutorials.description: After installing Vault, the next step is to start the server.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Your first secret
tutorials.description: With the Vault server running, let's read and write our first secret.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Secrets engines
tutorials.description: Secrets engines create, read, update, and delete secrets.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Dynamic secrets
tutorials.description: Learn how to generate AWS access keys dynamically using Vault.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Built-in help
tutorials.description: Vault has a built-in help system to learn about the available paths in Vault and how to use them.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Authentication
tutorials.description: Users can authenticate to Vault using multiple methods.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Policies
tutorials.description: Policies in Vault control what a user can access.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Deploy Vault
tutorials.description: Learn how to deploy Vault, including configuring, starting, initializing, and unsealing it.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Using the HTTP APIs with authentication
tutorials.shortName: Using the HTTP APIs with authentication
tutorials.description: HTTP APIs can control authentication and access to secrets.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Vault UI
tutorials.description: Vault comes with support for a user-friendly and functional Vault UI out of the box. Learn how to enable and launch the Vault UI.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Next steps
tutorials.description: Resources and further tracks now that you're confident using Vault.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

featuredCollections.name: HCP Vault quick start
featuredCollections.description: Quickly get hands-on with HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault using the HCP portal and setup your managed Vault cluster.

tutorials.name: What is Vault
tutorials.description: What is HashiCorp Vault and where does it fit in your organization?

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: What is HCP Vault
tutorials.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault enables you to deploy a managed Vault cluster and peer with a supported public cloud provider.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Create a Vault cluster on HCP
tutorials.shortName: Create a Vault cluster on HCP
tutorials.description:
HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault enables you to deploy a managed
Vault cluster and peer with a supported public cloud provider.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Access a Vault Cluster on HCP

tutorials.description:
HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault enables you to deploy a managed
Vault cluster and peer with a supported public cloud provider.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Multi-tenancy with Namespaces
tutorials.description:
HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault leverages Vault Enterprise Namespaces.
Learn the basics of how namespaces work in Vault.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Your first secret
tutorials.description: Enable and configure secrets engines to manage your secrets using HCP Vault.

tutorials.name: Create Vault policies
tutorials.description:
Create and manage access control list (ACL) policies to control access to
secrets managed by Vault.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Manage authentication methods
tutorials.description: Authentication is a process in Vault by which user or machine-supplied information is verified to create a token with an attached policy.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: HCP Vault operation tasks
tutorials.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Vault is a managed Vault service; therefore, the operational tasks are slightly different from a self-managed Vault cluster.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

certification.title: Get certified: Networking automation
certification.description: Validate your networking automation skills by studying for and passing the Consul Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started with HCP Consul
featuredCollections.description: Quickly get hands-on with HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Consul using the HCP portal quickstart deployment, learn about intentions, and route traffic using  service resolvers and service splitters.

tutorials.name: Deploy HCP Consul
tutorials.description: Deploy an end-to-end development environment, complete with an HVN, a HCP  Consul server cluster, a Consul client and demo application running on AWS EKS (Kubernetes) or EC2 (virtual machines).

product.name: Consul
product.description: Learn how to run service discovery and a service mesh with Consul.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Manage service access permission with intentions
tutorials.description: After you have set up the HCP Consul end-to-end (quickstart) deployment, create and modify intentions to learn how Consul manages service-to-service authorization and access permissions.

product.name: Consul
product.description: Learn how to run service discovery and a service mesh with Consul.

tutorials.name: Upgrade services with canary deployments
tutorials.description: After you have set up the HCP Consul end-to-end (quickstart) deployment,  create service splitters and service resolvers to gradually and safely  promote your services.

product.name: Consul
product.description: Learn how to run service discovery and a service mesh with Consul.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started
featuredCollections.description:
Get up and running with Nomad by learning about scheduling, setting up
a cluster, and deploying an example job.

tutorials.description: Learn about HashiCorp Nomad, job scheduling, and important terms.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Install Nomad
tutorials.description: Install the Nomad CLI to interact with Nomad clusters.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Create a cluster
tutorials.description: Create a local development cluster or a cloud-based one on one of the major cloud providers.

product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.description: Learn how to provision and run a Nomad cluster on the major clouds.

tutorials.description: Create a Nomad cluster on AWS with Consul and ACLs enabled to use as a starting point for your Nomad workloads.

featuredCollections.name: Deploy and Manage Nomad Jobs
featuredCollections.description:
Learn the fundamentals of expressing your workload as Nomad jobs. Submit,
inspect, and monitor a running Nomad job.

tutorials.name: Deploy and manage applications
tutorials.description: Learn how to deploy and manage a Nomad Job.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Learn how to configure tasks
tutorials.description:
Use Nomad's job specification to pass runtime configuration to your workloads
using command line arguments, environment variables, or configuration files.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Learn how to submit jobs to Nomad
tutorials.description:
Learn about Nomad job files. The job file is the unit of work in Nomad, and is
submitted to the server for evaluation and scheduling of your workload.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Inspect running jobs
tutorials.description:
Use the Nomad CLI to inspect the status of a running job to determine if it
started or what errors might have occurred.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Access application logs for troubleshooting
tutorials.description:
Inspect the logs of applications running in Nomad using the "nomad alloc logs"
command or the Nomad API.

product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Collect resource utilization metrics
tutorials.description:
Inspect a job's resource consumption and utilization information captured by
Nomad's task drivers.

product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

featuredCollections.name: Getting Started with Docker
featuredCollections.description: HashiCorp Packer automates the creation of any type of machine image, including Docker images. You'll build a  Docker image on your local machine without using any  paid cloud resources.

tutorials.name: Install Packer
tutorials.description: Packer must first be installed on the machine you want to run it on.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Build an image
tutorials.description:
With Packer installed, let's just dive right into it and build our first
image. Packer can create images for many platforms with anything pre-installed.
In this example, you will build a Docker image with Packer.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Provision
tutorials.description:
Packer fully supports automated provisioning in order to install software
onto machines prior to turning them into images.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Variables
tutorials.description: Packer templates can be parameterized using variables.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Parallel builds
tutorials.description:
Create multiple images for multiple platforms in parallel, from one Packer
template, by creating a source. Build Ubuntu and Ubuntu Focal images for Docker.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Post-processors
tutorials.description:
Packer also has the ability to modify the artifact of a build once the
instance has been shut down

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

featuredCollections.name: Getting Started with AWS
featuredCollections.description: HashiCorp Packer automates the creation of any type of machine image, including AWS AMIs. You'll build an Ubuntu machine image on AWS in this tutorial.

tutorials.name: Install Packer
tutorials.description: Packer must first be installed on the machine you want to run it on.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Build an image
tutorials.description: With Packer installed, let's build an Amazon EC2 AMI.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Provision
tutorials.description:
Packer fully supports automated provisioning in order to install software
onto machines prior to turning them into images.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Variables
tutorials.description: Packer templates can be parameterized using variables.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Parallel builds
tutorials.description:
Create multiple images for multiple platforms in parallel, from one Packer
template, by creating a source. Build Ubuntu and Ubuntu Focal images for AWS EBS.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Post-processors - Vagrant
tutorials.description: Create a Vagrant box with Packer post-processors.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started with HCP Packer
featuredCollections.description: HCP Packer registry stores Packer image metadata, enabling you to track your  image lifecycle. Build an Ubuntu machine image, push its metadata to AWS, and  reference the images in Terraform or Packer configuration.

tutorials.name: Push artifact metadata to the HCP Packer registry
tutorials.description: Push an artifact's metadata to the Packer registry. Explore the Packer  registry dashboard and view version details.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Control artifacts with channels

featuredCollections.name: Get Started
featuredCollections.description: Vagrant isolates dependencies and their configuration within a single disposable and consistent development environment.

tutorials.name: What is Vagrant?
tutorials.description: Create your first development environment with Vagrant. This quick start provides a brief introduction to Vagrant, its prerequisites, and an overview of three of the most important Vagrant commands to understand.

product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Install Vagrant
tutorials.description: Install Vagrant by visiting the Vagrant downloads page and downloading the appropriate installer or package for your platform. Packages are available for Mac, Windows, and distributions of Linux.

product.name: Vagrant
product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Initialize a project directory
tutorials.description: Create a project directory to set up your first Vagrant project. Then initialize the project with a Vagrantfile at its root.

product.name: Vagrant
product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Install and specify a box
tutorials.description: Vagrant uses a base image to quickly clone a virtual machine. In this tutorial specify a base image.

product.name: Vagrant
product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Boot an environment
tutorials.description: Bring up your first Vagrant environment, and SSH into the machine. Then destroy the virtual machine and remove the stored box.

product.name: Vagrant
product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Synchronize local and guest files
tutorials.description: Share files and folders between your local machine and the guest virtual machine to develop in your Vagrant environment while using your own text editor and other tools.

product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Share an environment

product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

tutorials.name: Rebuild an environment
tutorials.description:

product.name: Vagrant
product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant

featuredCollections.name: HCP Waypoint
featuredCollections.description: HCP Waypoint lets platform teams build golden patterns and workflows for developers to manage applications at scale. Developers can deploy self-service application infrastructure with a reusable template and add-on that includes a pre-populated code repository and no-code Terraform modules.
